column4: SPD owes Church & Dwight $10 mln in pregnancy test advertising case
column5: Pregnancy test maker SPD Swiss Precision Diagnostics GmbH must pay about $9.96 million to rival Church & Dwight Co Inc after running misleading advertising regarding a key differentiating feature in their products, a federal judge has ruled.
column6: U.S. District Judge Alison Nathan in Manhattan on Wednesday issued the damages award three years after she ruled that SPD had engaged in false advertising and intentional deception following a non-jury trial.
column7: To read the full story on Westlaw Practitioner Insights, click here: bit.ly/2MRBanb
